channel.title: News on Hugoplate
channel.description: Recent content in News on Hugoplate

item.title: Three doctors!
item.description: From three successful submissions to three new doctors – well done Dr. Soto, Dr. Martin, and Dr. O’Gara!

item.title: Alumni news
item.description:
Former L+PLUS Lab members are making a splash!

Congrats to Ehsan Solaimani on his new position at the University of Friborg in the ABCCD Lab, to Inma Soto on starting up at the Bilingualism and Psycholinguistics Research Lab at Northwestern, and to Willem van Boxtel who has accepted a tenure-track post at Louisiana State University in the Department of Communication Sciences and Disorders!

item.title: Coming soon
item.description: Xiaoduan and Laurie have a chapter coming out soon in a new book: Public Attitudes Towards Gender-Inclusive Language.

item.title: Three submissions!
item.description: In what will be long remembered as a historic day in the L+PLUS Lab, three of our lab members submitted their dissertations this week!

item.title: LabPhon special collection
item.description: The first article in the Journal of Laboratory Phonology special collection Distanced data collection: Remote data collection and online experimentation is out!

item.title: SNL 2023
item.description:
We’re in Marseille for SNL 2023!

Here’s L+PLUS Lab member Stephanie Martin presenting her work in session C, showing off some excellent work on lexical processing in bilingual children with DLD. Lab alum Willem van Boxtel also brought two excellent posters in sessions B and C outlining new work on structural priming in aphasia. Great to see so much great research this year!

item.title: Lab trip
item.description: The L+PLUS Lab went on location for our end-of-year bash. Here’s to the end of a very successful year!

item.title: Supervisor of the Year
item.description: Laurie won the PhD Supervisor of the Year award for Social Sciences this year. Thanks to everyone who nominated her!

item.title: New lab member!
item.description:
We’re happy to welcome Anugraha into the L+PLUS Lab.
Better keep a close eye on her, she’s going places!

item.title: Publication
item.description:
Just out: “Testing the Interpretability Hypothesis: Evidence from acceptability judgments of relative clauses by Persian and French learners of L2 English”, a new article from Ehsan and Laurie.
Check it out at Second Language Research !

item.title: Accent the Positive
item.description:
Laurie gave a talk in the Linguistics Department at the University of California, Davis on how primary-school children percieve standard and non-standard accents.
Check out more on the Accent the Positive page!

item.title: New publication
item.description:
Willem and Laurie have a new publication out in Language, Cognition and Neuroscience.
Check out syntactic comprehension priming and lexical boost effects in older adults!
